name: tonyhighwind
text: Don't fight it, man.  Just let the thing take it's course and try to guide it where you want it to go.

name: sabalpalm
text: get a new girlfriend

name: anonymous44
text: seconded

name: alzuna
text: My boyfriend won't read Achewood, even though I've tried to get him to... *sadface*

name: cryztal
text:
Neither my boyfriend nor my roommate will read it with me.

I like to think it's because it's too above them. Sympathy chubby!

name: prettyrad
text: I showed my girlfriend bits of the Great Outdoor Fight book, but instead of the mutually titillated reaction I was expecting, it was actually... well, it was actually a bit awkward. I still quote Achewood in conversation and have to explain what I'm on about, which is perhaps more awkward, yet increasingly unavoidable.

name: cryztal
text:
Do you at least have Achewood friends? The only way I get by in conversation is by having at least one to catch my no-entirely-subtle references.

Good luck dude. It took an ex-boyfriend 6 months after we broke up to get me into Achewood. :(

name: prettyrad
text: I have internet Achewood friends. Does that count?

name: cryztal
text: Well, I should think so!

name: money4something
text: All I see when I look at this conversation is Roast Beef playing peekaboo.

name: ravindra108
text: Nice.

name: ohnoadeathray
text: Man, I got some of my friends because of achewood.

name: dusty
text: This string of stories about the support or lack of it from peoples partners for their Achewood reading is reminding me of a herpes treatment commercial.

name: cryztal
text: But is anyone getting hugged from behind while some dramatic-but-hopeful piano is played? Is there a sweater tied to one's shoulders?

name: dusty
text: I assume that part begins after the announcer tells us about medicine for not getting Achewood. Since were still in the sad part of the commercial your avatar fits perfectly. Unfortunately this medication can only be bought legally at a few dispensaries in California.

name: cryztal
text:
Also in Denver!

But I see what you mean. Before the part where they talk about the [genital herpes] medication they make it seem like you are forever diseased and unloved... but man, once you start takin' that shit it's dicksville/vaginatown/anusopolis* from there!

*If you not enjoy any of these things, replace the thing that gives you chubs and end it with a city-related suffix. (i.e., Fursuitsville.)

name: dusty
text: Also it allows you to drive a restored powder blue 57 Chevy Bel Air down a beautiful coastal highway while a sexy woman in a flowery dress rides in the passenger seat and laughs with you. For some reason this is never contrasted like the looking sad and apart on the couch/dancing together in a garden juxtaposition. Why not have a before shot where a guy drives a white civic with holes in the paint through western new jersey while a woman in a moo-moo and crocks with a bitchy look scowls at him (because he has a herpes outbreak)?

name: dj_insomniac
text: Get a new boyfriend.

name: vheissu
text: My my that avatar is hell of awesome. Do you still go on Homestar Runner? I haven't been in a while. I am worried that it will suck and my 'five-years ago' self will be crushed.

name: epicurus
text: Homestar Runner is still good. It's not getting less funny with age so much as we're getting less able to enjoy it.

name: gunsofray
text: Tell him only REAL men read Achewood, and dont talk to him for a few days.

name: pogo
text: We should all have Achewood-approving significant others.  Or at least Achewood-tolerant.  Screw the Achewood-averse ones!  Fuck them!

name: akarroa
text: Your last 2 sentences almost contradict the first one.

name: pogo
text: 'Tis true, the English language has two opposite meanings for both "screw" and "fuck," one very nice and one very negative.  It is only in context that we know the difference.

name: unquotable
text: Achewood, sterilize your bitches.

name: chuchurocket
text: bitches gotta be takin' their cunt pills.  i ain't wearin' no gunnysack.

name: trevor328
text:
I work in IT and I can also attest to that distinctive "shhhhuck" sound a uterus makes when it closes for business.

It's also the sound of my sperm crying.

name: saint
text: This is the saddest thing.

name: omegatron
text: Get a new job.

name: agika
text: Roast Beef's household must be rough for Molly.

name: jamers
text: Ray is somewhat insensitive to Beef's lifestyle in this strip.

name: soticoto
text:
Ray is somewhat of a dick in this strip.

I mean... frankly... any girl whose tits would drop off and uterus seal shut at the mention of such things is probably better off that way. Best to keep the idiots out of the gene-pool.

name: selbencoirlo
text: As Ray points out, this shit ain't exactly rocket science. In fact, I'm beginning to wonder if rocket science is actually rocket science.

name: mangtastic
text:
It's all just ratios and chemistry and calculus and physics and shit.

Actually that sounds pretty hard except for the ratios, which one can easily look up.

name: terribleman
text: I was scrolling down to see if someone had already pointed out that Ray is being a dick here. Way to make your best friend feel bad. Not cool.

text: You will struggle to be original in the unclothed internet lady niche. I'm just saying.

name: hollis
text: My point exactly... hence the lack of titty photos.

name: boredom_man
text: Eventually, you will view a nude painting older than Coca-Cola, realize there is nothing new to be revealed, and take photographs of whatever you please and sell them by the pound.

name: ragnarok_engine
text: OKAY, SHOW US YER PANCREAS

name: greenkoolayd
text: totally.  the only thing more intimate than skin is whats underneath it.

name: ford
text: I gave this a chubby because i think its a joke.  up yours if it isn't a joke (but not up yours if it is).

name: soticoto
text: Dog, you are SUCH a douche.

name: hollis
text:
Dude, I think I got the point when various people lamed my comment, and the entire conversation that preceded from it, into oblivion (or oblivion defined by my 3-lame-limit filter, anyway). I'm sorry my comment wasn't adequately thoughtful. No need to call me a douche.

I realize this comment will also probably get lamed into oblivion before you read it, but just thought I'd put it out there.

name: semiquaver
text: He was calling caduceo a douche, I believe.  You've been quite entertaining throughout.  Might I suggest setting your lame filter higher?  I keep mine at thirty so I can read asherdan and Dr. Manflesh comments--no need to go so extreme, but you'll miss a lot of extremely popular comments with a lame filter that low.

name: soticoto
text:
I like Dr Manflesh too.
He wins.

name: epicurus
text: My threshold for lames and chubbies is 10, and that works great. I reccomend it highly.

name: semiquaver
text: I'll try it out.

name: soticoto
text:
I like you hollis (chubb granted as gesture of good will). The comment wasn't aimed at you.
I am curious though... why would you think it was? It didn't follow from yours... and I referred specifically to a dog.
Do you have a tail to tell us?

name: hollis
text: I think I did not pick up on the fact that caduceo's avatar is a dog because (as semiquaver pointed out) my lame filter is set too low.  It seems like all the cool kids are using 10 these days, so I will too.    Thanks for assuaging my concerns :)

name: soticoto
text:
So with that in mind, have your chest-decor changed significantly in the past two years?

Tis not perversity but SCIENCE that compels me to ask.

name: greenkoolayd
text: im sure shes a hot piece of brain, too.

name: jackparsons
text:
"Isn't Unix made by fat people?" is harsher than this. "The Debonair Sysadmin" is more affectionate. And, yes, I own hats.

No matter how nerdy and unkempt, if you can synthesize hallucinogenic drugs, you are soooooo in.

name: spenham
text: I'm not a cock-doctor, but I do play one on TV. Reversing a vasectomy is effective in only 50%-70% of cases. You can visit my website here .

If vasectomies have a 50% success rate at worst, then at least one testicle would be reconnected successfully out of the two of them.

This may be wrong though, as maths were my worst subject.

I call bullshit on that. Ray has like a whole blog post about always wearing rubber. And he (tried to) have the jimmyhat talk with Little Nephew.

text: I love-love- love the last panel inference that if you can get stuff onto your iPod, say, four or five outta ten tries, you might never have a family.

text: I've never understood how people can have trouble getting files on their ipod. I mean...you don't have to do any thing except plug your ipod into your computer. iTunes literally does all the work for you.
